# Problem 1
In the figure below, choose point $D$ on $\overline{BC}$ so that $\triangle ACD$ and $\triangle ABD$ have equal perimeters. What is the area of $\triangle ABD$?

<img src="//latex.artofproblemsolving.com/5/3/e/53eb67d35ecca7ac6f68e8dff60b0eb5f3e4a602.png" class="latexcenter" alt="[asy]draw((0,0)--(4,0)--(0,3)--(0,0)); label(&quot;$A$&quot;, (0,0), SW); label(&quot;$B$&quot;, (4,0), ESE); label(&quot;$C$&quot;, (0, 3), N); label(&quot;$3$&quot;, (0, 1.5), W); label(&quot;$4$&quot;, (2, 0), S); label(&quot;$5$&quot;, (2, 1.5), NE);[/asy]" width="252" height="198" style="filter: invert(100%);">

# Problem 2
An integer between $1000$ and $9999$, inclusive, is chosen at random. What is the probability that it is an odd integer whose digits are all distinct?
<details>
<summary>Click to show solution</summary>

<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/869879982044905545/939785694409293854/Screen_Shot_2022-02-06_at_6.32.42_pm.png" style="filter: invert(100%);">

</details>
<br>
# Problem 3
It is known that $\sqrt{b}+c = \sqrt{10+2\sqrt{24}}$. If $b$ and $c$ are both integers, find the value of $(b+c)^2$.
<details>
<summary>Click to show solution</summary>

<img src="https://attachments.office.net/owa/GarvShah%40caulfieldgs.vic.edu.au/service.svc/s/GetAttachmentThumbnail?id=AAMkAGJmMjBkYjVjLWViMzQtNDg1Mi05ZDc3LTc0MjkwMmM0NDI1NwBGAAAAAABiiRSq5W1jR7fm%2FpeiZt7NBwA6jC8QenuFQ4LPrLXLa6AqAAAAAAEMAAA6jC8QenuFQ4LPrLXLa6AqAAL0Y93aAAABEgAQACAwsM2oAxlKiBbHKlxqlF0%3D&thumbnailType=2&token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IkZBRDY1NDI2MkM2QUYyOTYxQUExRThDQUI3OEZGMUIyNzBFNzA3RTkiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJ4NXQiOiItdFpVSml4cThwWWFvZWpLdDRfeHNuRG5CLWsifQ..RzDErx37D_ajssbpSr9YVtJAYQze9U1zYDppkCyrXlKwFovfW_MYpAqlKkHeR2VAxL2LlucylIpd3Vud19lLGuh2kJQ-Ot1wBUQSkgUFO_RUqW3YpZSdfMlOiUyOWYXNy2_xEh3j0FKaO-C31bR9OpvWKO_rxPOgr7dFm6t4A2c8H24xSsUoMH44dQ1EKQ9duJ191UGT24gKPwWHIv08u63G5pmSm7CnSv0g2LNSmaQjv73y_ghhSMtiZE2ImUgQpPeDhkmfrwPboW5fDXNqtgFh4OMP9IwvoQXiCs0P1GWpXpkl2k9vYWeLaXF-_9ktcy8mbq70Tg1EA9Nra2NvoA&X-OWA-CANARY=8DmXgry-Vk6yFLKX29OuTzDmxUtD6dkYoEktoV-Hz-KzP15dOo0OCwwtJoM_ijZ0b3lH2VCtUT0.&owa=outlook.office.com&scriptVer=20220128003.07&animation=true">

# Problem 4
if $a+\frac{1}{b}=6, a^3+\frac{1}{b^3}=180$, find the value of $\frac{a}{b}$.
<details>
<summary>Click to show solution</summary>
